image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at a media conference.

props.synopsis: SA's Commissioner into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Natasha Stott Despoja is no stranger to taking on a big task. But the job of tackling domestic, family and sexual violence in the state requires structural, practical and cultural change. Despite countless harrowing tales, she remains hopeful that can be achieved, Jessica Haynes writes.

title.children: 'I am tired of living in fear': DV royal commissioner hopeful for real change

image.altText: A man in a high vis green top and a green hat in a carpark outside with a sunny blue sky.

props.synopsis: People living with disability in regional South Australia say it is hard to navigate new career paths as they do not have enough employment opportunities in their towns.Â

title.children: People living with disability seek more variety in job opportunities

image.altText: A car parked outside a home, with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A post-mortem report had listed the victim's cause of death as "unascertained", while the alleged killer was granted release on home detention bail, but was not released as a suitable address was not identified.

title.children: Alleged murder victim's body not found for 20 days, court hears

image.altText: Three people walking on a beach.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he does not want to "get into semantics" over categorising South Australia's devastating algal bloom as a national disaster but will "provide support as requested".

title.children: PM sticks to 'event', rather than 'disaster', to describe SA algal bloom

image.altText: Izak Rankine running with the ball, looking for a teammate to kick to in an AFL match.

props.synopsis: The AFL grants Adelaide's request for more time to respond to the league's "proposed determinations" over an alleged homophobic slur by Crows star Izak Rankine.

title.children: AFL gives Crows more time to respond as Rankine decision drags on

image.altText: A woman standing in front of a stone building.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party names its candidates for the state's South East seats, currently held by independents facing unrelated legal troubles.Â

title.children: Two Liberal women hope to capture SA seats from controversial independents

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis:
The 29 childcare centres were the first issued with compliance actions over ongoing failures to meet quality standards, following laws passed by parliament last month.Â 

Â

title.children: Names released of 29 failing childcare centres at risk of losing funding

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: A new report has revealed isolations at South Australia's only youth detention centre increased by 50 per cent during a period last year and has questioned the legality of their use, with one respondent saying they felt they were being "punished like a dog".Â

title.children: 'Punished like a dog': Report reveals increase in isolations at SA youth detention centre

image.altText: A close up of Sally McManus in the Insiders studio.

props.synopsis: The treasurer's priority in this term has shifted from tackling cost of living to productivity and the unions are yet to score a victory.

title.children: So much for the union 'stitch-up' predicted by the Coalition ahead of the roundtable

image.altText: Ken Hinkley looks on while wearing glasses on his head

props.synopsis: The 13-season coach leaves Port Adelaide with a higher winning percentage than some of the AFL's great modern-day coaches, but regrets the one thing missing on his resume.

title.children: 'It stings a lot': Ken Hinkley on lasting legacy at Port ahead of farewell

image.altText: Defeated SA Best leader Nick Xenophon with his successful candidates.

props.synopsis: Independent-turn-Liberal Frank Pangallo has styled himself as "the watchdog" in the lead-up to the 2026 state election, but time will tell if the gamble pays off, writes Daniel Keane.Â

title.children: Will a former journalist help the Liberals recapture this 'blue ribbon' seat?

image.altText: Ukraine's ambassador to Japan Sergiy Korsunsky walks past a map.

props.synopsis: A decade ago, Donetsk was the metropolis of Ukraine's east. Now, Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly has it squarely in his sights.

title.children: The territories Putin wants and what it will mean for Ukraine

image.altText: Michele Vanderlanh Smith balcony

props.synopsis: As insurance premiums across the country rise, insurers are posting bumper profits. Consumer advocates say policyholders have a right to know why.

title.children: Consumers left in the dark about steep hikes to insurance premium

image.altText: An emperor penguin lies down in the snow, behind a small grey fluffy penguin chick.

props.synopsis: Scientists say there is emerging evidence of abrupt and potentially unstoppable changes in the Antarctic environment, heightening the risk of significant sea level rise and the extinction of species.

title.children: Scientists warn of 'abrupt changes' taking place in Antarctica

image.altText: A woman at a table looking at her AI companion on her phone.

props.synopsis: Hayley's AI companion is credited with changing her life but for others they can be used for sex or even convey sinister overtones, Raising questions over whether the industry needs regulation.

title.children: 'Relationship she might not have had': Hayley's AI partner changed her life

image.altText: Donald Trump with one arm raised in a fist above his head.

props.synopsis: Meta, Citigroup, and local school districts are among the companies and government entities which the US president has bought bonds from in the past seven months, disclosure logs show.

title.children: Donald Trump buys $155 million in bonds in months since inauguration

image.altText: Dressed in a three-piece suit and tie, Oliver Schulz carries a coat on his arm, looking serious outside court.

props.synopsis: A former special forces trooper will be the first Australian soldier to stand trial for a war crime, more than 13 years after he shot dead a villager in an Afghan field.

title.children: Former SAS trooper to be first Australian soldier to face war crime trial

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann carrying a bag beside a woman dressed in black.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's bid to overturn a finding that he raped his former colleague Brittany Higgins has not started smoothly, with Federal Court judges questioning the logic of his grounds of appeal.

title.children: 'I don't understand': Logic of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal bid questioned by judges

image.altText: Small white star speck surrounded by a transparent greyish cloud against a black background.

props.synopsis: A supernova blast 2.2 billion light-years from Earth has given astronomers a deeper view into a star's centre than ever before.

title.children: 'Awestruck': Astronomers get first glimpse inside a dying star

image.altText: A woman sits in her home, being interviewed

props.synopsis: A patient caught up in the immense pressure being placed on WA hospitals says her planned surgery being cancelled has put her under significant stress and eroded her trust in the health system.

title.children: Patient whose surgery cancelled after 350-day wait 'inconsolable'

image.altText: Cars stopped at traffic lights in Sydney as pedestrians walk past.

props.synopsis: Australia's peak motoring body is calling for more transparency around the cause of fatalities involving pedestrians.

title.children: Pedestrian deaths up by almost 50 per cent over four-year period

image.altText: Andrew Larcos with his dad at a restaurant by the water

props.synopsis: From having to give up a job, to feeling like life is on hold, readers share the challenges and guilt around caring for an aging parent.

title.children: 'Hardest thing I've done': Readers on caring for an aging parent

image.altText: South Melbourne FC fans hold up scarves in the stands at an Australia Cup game.

props.synopsis: In a fixture dubbed The Big Show, more than 9,000 screaming fans packed this local football game in a sign these clubs could be ready for the A-League.

title.children: After packing out the 'Big Show', these clubs want a shot in the big leagues

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie

props.synopsis: An Uber driver who narrowly escaped death and the victim's violent criminal history are key pieces of a puzzle police are pouring over after Tuesday's shooting.

title.children: Sydney shooting victim's violent home invasion before death

image.altText: A man smiling in a suit, walking into a room full of people.

props.synopsis: Joshua Barton Willie, a 41-year-old former primary school teacher, is the new leader of Tasmanian Labor â tasked with trying to engineer a comeback after the party's fourth consecutive election loss to the Liberals.

title.children: Who is Josh Willie, new leader of Tasmanian Labor?

image.altText: man wearing scarf, hat and sunglasses is ushered into a court

props.synopsis: The musician is alleged to have waved the yellow flag of Hezbollah during a Kneecap gig in London on November 21, 2024.

title.children: Member of Irish rap group Kneecap appears in court on terrorism charge

image.altText: A white woman with brown hair touches the side of her face as she poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Actor Aubrey Plaza speaks for the first time about the sudden death of her husband, Jeff Baena, saying her life has become a daily struggle.

title.children: 'Daily struggle': Aubrey Plaza speaks about husband's death

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with his chin up and Benjamin Netanyahu with his mouth slightly open. Flags behind each

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have both been chastised over their "war of words" by one of Australia's central Jewish community groups, following the announcement Australia would recognise Palestine next month.Â

title.children: Jewish group chastises Albanese and Netanyahu's 'war of words'

image.altText: Air Asia X plane close up

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on the federal government to strengthen consumer protections in the aviation sector after a budget airline left travellers stranded and out of pocket when it abruptly cancelled services to a popular holiday destination.Â

title.children: Budget airline AirAsia cuts popular tourist route out of Australia

image.altText: Melania Trump looking to her right while wearing a white coat and top, standing in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Throughout history, first ladies have been designated with traditional female roles. But they also have a long tradition of speaking out on key political issues.

title.children: Melania Trump's peace letter to Vladimir Putin was a display of soft power

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: A report by the Queensland Productivity Commission recommended the state should opt out of the National Construction Code's accessibility standards.

title.children: Report suggests Qld opt out of building accessibility standards

image.altText: Aerial view of a wrapped bouquet and assorted stuffed toys lain on dirt next to a drain.

props.synopsis: Police say a woman aged in her 30s is assisting them with inquiries into the death of a newborn baby whose body was found by maintenance workers in a storm drain in suburban Perth on Monday afternoon.

title.children: Woman assisting police after baby's body found in Perth drain

image.altText: A man with a white shirt and tie walking alongside a woman with a black top.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright's friend has denied committing perjury out of loyalty to the celebrity croc wrangler after accusations he became "tangled in [his] own lies" during the trial.

title.children: Matt Wright's friend accused of being 'tangled in his own lies' during trial

image.altText: An underground scene showing a wall of coal and mining machinery.

props.synopsis: Peabody Energy has terminated a deal to buy five Anglo American coal mines in the Bowen Basin citing an underground ignition at the Moranbah North mine in March.

title.children: $5.7 billion, five coal mine deal termination sparks arbitration

image.altText: A pile of bricks and rubbish between a fence and a shed.

props.synopsis: After relying on a buyer's agent for expert advice, a "blindsided" Sydney couple discovers their investment property has costly hidden problems.

title.children: Investors issue warning on buyer's agents after costly property blunder
